abstract: Many New York City residents have no access to reliable, fast internet connection despite 2008 deal struck by former Mayor Michael R Bloomberg, which gave Verizon city-wide franchise in exchange for promise to make fiber optic network available to all of city's 3 million homes by end of 2014; Mayor Bill de Blasio, who has made universal broadband access priority, says Verizon has not fulfilled terms of contract but company insists that it has.
lead_paragraph: The company says it met its promise to have fiber-optic cable for FiOS pass all three million homes in the city by the end of last year. The city’s response: not even close.

headline.main: As Service Gaps Remain, City Says Verizon Broke Promise on FiOS
headline.print_headline: As Service Gaps Remain, City Says Verizon Broke Promise on FiOS

snippet: The company says it met its promise to have fiber-optic cable for FiOS pass all three million homes in the city by the end of last year. The city’s response: not even close.
